snippet: The compact sedan earned the honor over the Ford Focus and Volkswagen Passat, while the Evoque beat out the Honda CR-V and BMW X3.
abstract: The compact sedan earned the honor over the Ford Focus and Volkswagen Passat, while the Evoque beat out the Honda CR-V and BMW X3.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT -- Selected by a jury of 50 automotive journalists from print, television, Web and radio, the Hyundai Elantra compact sedan was named North American Car of the Year here on Monday morning. Of the Elantra, which beat out the Ford Focus and Volkswagen Passat, Ken Gross, an automotive journalist, said in a media release that it offered "beaucoup bang for the buck, impressive mileage; it feels like a more expensive car." Even so, there was a collective gasp here at Cobo Center when the announcement was made.

headline.main: Hyundai Elantra Is Car of the Year; Range Rover Evoque Is Truck of the Year
